dedicated_server_interfaces_ola_descript: OLA allows you to configure a network interface and modify how it operates.  For example, use the public network interface to obtain dual connectivity to the private OVH network (vRack)
dedicated_server_interfaces_ola_alert_co: The interfaces will be reconfigured. Connectivity to your server will be lost during the configuration process
dedicated_server_interfaces_ola_alert_ob: The network option on your public interface won't be used.
dedicated_server_interfaces_ola_alert_no: These interfaces are not selectable for your configuration:
dedicated_server_interfaces_ola_field_mo: OLA is able to offer different types of interface configurations
The server's network interfaces are configured as when the server was delivered. One interface for the public network (Internet), another for the private network (vRack)
The 2 network interfaces of the server are used for the private network (vRack). Each link has the basic or optional bandwidth. NOTE: the server is no longer accessible via its public IP.
dedicated_server_interfaces_ola_step2_de: Choose the interfaces you want to group together.
Choose the aggregated interface you want to unbundle.
